citeinfo.origin: U.S. Geological Survey, Earthquake Hazards Program
citeinfo.title: Advanced National Seismic System (ANSS) Comprehensive Catalog

descript.abstract: The ANSS Comprehensive Catalog (ComCat) contains earthquake source parameters (e.g. hypocenters, magnitudes, phase picks and amplitudes) and other products (e.g. moment tensor solutions, macroseismic information, tectonic summaries, maps) produced by contributing seismic networks. This comprehensive collection of seismic information replaces the ANSS composite catalog previously hosted by the Northern California Data Center. Important digital catalogs of earthquake source parameters (e.g. Centennial Catalog, Global Centroid Moment Tensor Catalog) are loaded into ComCat. New and updated data is added to the catalog dynamically as sources publish or update products.
descript.purpose: The purpose of the dataset is to provide a comprehensive catalog of earthquake related data and and products.

idinfo.accconst: No access constraints as all data are non-proprietary
idinfo.useconst: The data you have secured from the ANSS Comprehensive Catalog may include data that have not received Directorâ€™s approval and as such are provisional and subject to revision. The data are released on the condition that neither the USGS nor the United States Government may be held liable for any damages resulting from its authorized or unauthorized use
idinfo.datacred: Data are provided by dozens of national and international seismic networks. Attributions can be found on individual data points.
idinfo.native: XML, QuakeML 1.2, GeoJSON, KML, CSV, JPEG

attracc.attraccr: The attribute accuracy depends on the contributed individual dataset and may or may not be available for any record.

dataqual.logic: A statement on system performance metrics and completeness is under development.
dataqual.complete: A statement on system performance metrics and completeness is under development.

horizpa.horizpar: The positional accuracy depends on the contributed individual dataset and may or may not be available for any record.

vertacc.vertaccr: The positional accuracy depends on the contributed individual dataset and may or may not be available for any record.

procstep.procdesc: Seismic data processing is a complex process that varies by data type and contributor. The data were produced by many tools and models. See http://pubs.usgs.gov/fs/2006/3050/ for some information.

distinfo.distliab: Freely available on demand in xml or csv format.

digtinfo.formname: Earthquake Hazards Program: Real-time Feeds & Notifications
digtinfo.formcont: We have various web services with predefined parameters based on time and magnitude. See http://earthquake.usgs.gov/earthquakes/feed for more a description of web services.

distinfo.custom: Freely available on demand in xml or csv format. See http://earthquake.usgs.gov/earthquakes/feed/v1.0/

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standards for Digital Geospatial Metadata
